Description: Fragment of stand of Attic red-figured pottery lebes gamikos; reserved standing surface and interior. Edge of foot glazed; tongues on lower wall with scrap of red-figure scene preserved above.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 97 no. 333 pl. 71)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1891)
